text.tspan: 1. Heat oil on medium heat in a large,
deep skillet. Add onion, carrots,
and garlic and saut√© for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and pork and
continue to cook.
2. When meat is browned and onions
are soft, add tomatoes.
3. When tomatoes have softened
and have started to release their
juices (about 4-5 min) add basil,
sugar, salt and pepper (if you are
using whole tomatoes, mash them
with a potato masher or spatula
to release all their juices).
4. Simmer for at least 3 hours
(and up to 6 hours), stirring
occasionally. The longer you simmer,
the better. Important: tomatoes
burn easily, so keep an eye on them
and add beef broth a little at a
time to thin sauce if needed.
5. In a large pot, cook spaghetti in
salted water to al dente, drain
completely and return to pot.
Add sauce to the spaghetti noodles
and toss until noodles are covered.
6. Serve immediately.
